questions.question: What improves website visibility in search results?
questions.explanation: SEO optimizes sites for search engines.

questions.question: Which element describes page content to search engines?
questions.explanation: Meta tags provide page information to crawlers.

questions.question: What words do users search for?
questions.explanation: Keywords are search terms users type.

questions.question: What links point to your site from others?
questions.explanation: Backlinks are inbound links from external sites.

questions.question: Which search engine dominates the market?
questions.explanation: Google is the most widely used search engine.

questions.question: What describes a page's main topic?
questions.explanation: Title tags define page titles in search results.

questions.question: What measures site loading speed?
questions.explanation: Page speed indicates how fast pages load.

questions.question: What optimizes sites for mobile devices?
questions.explanation: Mobile-friendly design adapts to smaller screens.

questions.question: What creates SEO-friendly web addresses?
questions.explanation: Clean URLs are readable and descriptive.

questions.question: What file guides search engine crawlers?
